Package edu.sru.cpsc.webshopping.controller

Class TransactionController

java.lang.Object
edu.sru.cpsc.webshopping.controller.TransactionController
@RestController public class TransactionController extends Object
Class for interacting with the database for Transaction objects

  • Method Details

    • addTransaction

      @PostMapping("add-transaction-binding") public void addTransaction(@Validated Transaction transaction, org.springframework.validation.BindingResult result)

    • addTransaction

      @PostMapping("add-transaction") public Transaction addTransaction(@Validated Transaction transaction)
      Creates a new Transaction, based on the details held in the passed Transaction Requires that the MarketListing held by transaction already exist in the database Requires that the ShippingEntry held by transaction be new
      Parameters:
      transaction - the transaction to add to the database

    • getUserPurchases

      @GetMapping("get-users-purchases") public Iterable<Transaction> getUserPurchases(@Validated User user)
      Gets an Iterable of all of the purchases that a user has made
      Parameters:
      user - the user to find the purchases of
      Returns:
      an Iterable of a User's purchases

    • getUserSoldItems

      @GetMapping("get-users-sold-items") public Iterable<Transaction> getUserSoldItems(@Validated User user)
      Gets an Iterable of all the transactions sold by the user
      Parameters:
      user - the user to find the sold transactions of
      Returns:
      an Iterable of the Transactions sold by the user

    • getTransaction

      @RequestMapping("get-transaction/{id}") public Transaction getTransaction(@PathVariable("id") long id)
      Gets a specific Transaction
      Parameters:
      id - the id of the Transaction to find
      Returns:
      the found Transaction
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - is thrown if the id is not associated with an existing transaction

    • cancelTransaction

      @GetMapping("cancel-transaction") public boolean cancelTransaction(@Validated Transaction trans)
      Cancels a specific Transaction This deletes the Transaction and its associated Shipping entry
      Parameters:
      trans - the Transaction to delete
      Returns:
      true if deleted, false otherwise
